revised_title: Development of Percussion Shells for Improved Projectile Accuracy
tldr: Lieutenant Colonel Miller develops a percussion shell that can be fired horizontally from a common gun, improving accuracy by giving the shell a spiral motion. The shell's design includes a cylindrical form with a conical apex, allowing it to explode upon impact. Successful tests were conducted at Kinsale Fort and Leith Fort, with some shells exploding at distances of up to 1200 yards.
